channel.title: First Things Podcast
channel.description:
First Things is published by The Institute on Religion and Public Life, an interreligious, nonpartisan research and education institute whose purpose is to advance a religiously informed public philosophy for the ordering of society.
Learn more: www.firstthings.com/learnmore
channel.itunes:subtitle: First Things is published by The Institute on Religion and Public Life

item.title: Scott Yenor on Sexual Counter-Revolution—The Editor’s Desk
item.itunes:title: Scott Yenor on Sexual Counter-Revolution—The Editor’s Desk
item.description: Scott Yenor joins editor R. R. Reno to discuss his article from the November edition, “Sexual Counter-Revolution,” as well as his book on the subject, “The Recovery of Family Life: Exposing the Limits of Modern Ideologies.”
item.content:encoded: Scott Yenor joins editor R. R. Reno to discuss his article from the November edition, “Sexual Counter-Revolution,” as well as his book on the subject, “The Recovery of Family Life: Exposing the Limits of Modern Ideologies.”
item.itunes:subtitle: Scott Yenor joins editor R. R. Reno to discuss his article from the November edition, “Sexual Counter-Revolution,” as well as his book on the subject, “The Recovery of Family Life: Exposing the Limits of Modern Ideologies.”
item.itunes:summary: Scott Yenor joins editor R. R. Reno to discuss his article from the November edition, “Sexual Counter-Revolution,” as well as his book on the subject, “The Recovery of Family Life: Exposing the Limits of Modern Ideologies.”

item.title: Julia Yost on Trauma—The Editor’s Desk
item.itunes:title: Julia Yost on Trauma—The Editor’s Desk
item.description: Julia Yost joins editor R. R. Reno on the podcast to talk about the best-selling book "The Body Keeps the Score," and the effects the book has had on our political discourse.

item.title: Dan Lipinski on Common Good Republicans—The Editor’s Desk
item.itunes:title: Dan Lipinski on Common Good Republicans—The Editor’s Desk
item.description: On the inaugural episode of the new First Things podcast "The Editor's Desk," Russell Reno interviews Daniel Lipinski about his recent article, "Common Good Republicans." They discuss the past and future of pro-life politics in both the Democratic and Republican parties.
item.content:encoded: On the inaugural episode of the new First Things podcast "The Editor's Desk," Russell Reno interviews Daniel Lipinski about his recent article, "Common Good Republicans." They discuss the past and future of pro-life politics in both the Democratic and Republican parties.
